subject: Probelm
description_text:
Hello

I recently purchased the Ultra X pedals, but I am experiencing an issue.
In my games, the pedals are being detected with 4 axes instead of 3, which
is causing configuration problems.

Could you please help me resolve this issue?

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,

conversations.body_text: Hi YoT Black,     Please use version 2.1.1 of the software. In the interface, click “Restore”, then click “Save”, and finally re-plug the USB. This will disable the fourth axis (RX).  https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BAdSWa1bxmbPksj9Hlzuo8bl7_bM8ixr/view?usp=drivesdk

Hello, I’ve just installed your file and followed the procedure, but now
the brake pedal no longer works, and the pedal set light doesn’t turn on
either, nor do the vibration motors behind each pedal. Can you help me?

Le sam. 4 oct. 2025, 04:27, service@simsonn.com

Hi YoT Black,     Please uninstall the previous version from your computer, as the earlier update may have caused file issues. Then, install version 2.1.2 and update the firmware. After the update, the device should display: CPU1: 2.0.5, CPU2: 2.0.3.    https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PZwHUqhhmJw0IBGDO8mGONPbrICJU3z1/view?usp=drive_link

Dear [Support Team],

I followed the update process exactly as explained in your previous
message. I now have the correct firmware and software versions, but I’m
still experiencing an unstable axis, and my haptic (vibration) sensors are
not being recognized.

I truly appreciate your responsiveness and the overall quality of the
hardware. However, the software remains highly unstable, which makes the
product very difficult to use. Considering these ongoing issues, I believe
the device does not currently justify its price, as it prevents me from
fully enjoying my sim racing setup.

I sincerely hope you can provide a definitive solution to resolve these
problems, or alternatively, offer an appropriate commercial gesture or
refund.

Best regards,


Le dim. 5 oct. 2025, 17:39, service@simsonn.com

Hi YoT Black,    Please provide your order number so I can confirm whether you have the ProX or ProX Ultra pedals.     Also, please follow the steps below:      Unplug both the pedal’s USB cable and the vibration feedback power cable.  Reconnect the USB cable first, then plug in the power supply.  Open the vibration feedback interface and check whether the power indicator shows green (connected).  Make sure the USB is connected directly to the rear USB 3.0 blue port on your PC. Please do not use a USB hub or USB 2.0 port, as they may provide unstable power.  In the latest firmware version, the RX axis issue should no longer occur.         If the issue persists, I can assist you remotely. Please install ToDesk (no registration required) and provide your ID and password. We can schedule a quick remote session to identify and fix the problem.
